Rule Available Attributes

 

  • Rule Available Attributes
    • Filters
    • Creating an Available Attribute.
    • Editing Available Attributes
    • Details View
    • Deleting a Available Attributes
      • Field Description
      • Action Buttons

The Rule available attributes UI lists the available attributes for a given component. The base provides an exhaustive list of attributes. However, if need be, attributes can be added/edited/deleted. Please exercise caution while editing/deleting the attributes provided by the base. The available attributes are system augmentable and hence they can only be maintained by the user 'system admin'. If any other user tries to carry out any create, edit, or delete operations, an error is thrown to the user.

 

Filters

The available attributes filters are:

1) Attribute Id

2) Entity Id

3) Attribute Label

4) Alternate Name

5) List Data Type

6) List Functions

7) Source Type

8) Source URL

9) Source Value

 

Creating an Available Attribute.

To create a new available attribute:

Select the allocation component name from the filter panel.

 

  1. Select Menu > Configuration > Common > Available Attributes
  2. Enter the filter criteria and click Apply. You will see the records on the list pane.
  3. Click Create to view the Available Attributes window.
  4. On the Available Attributes page, enter a unique Attribute Id (name of the attribute).
  5. Select the Source Entity to which the attribute ID belongs from the drop-down list.
  6. Select the Data Type of attribute from the drop-down list.

  7. Enter the Attribute Label of an attribute.

  8. Enter the Alternate Name of an attribute.

  9. Enter the List Data Type of an attribute.

  10. Enter the List Functions of an attribute.

  11. Enter the Source Type of an attribute.

  12. Enter the Source URL of an attribute.

  13. Enter the Source Value of an attribute

  14. Click Save.

Editing Available Attributes

To edit available attribute:

 

Swipe-out List

  1. Select Menu > Configuration > Common > Available Attributes
  2. Enter the filter criteria and click Apply. You will see the records on the list pane.
  3. Select the required available attribute record. Swipe-out the menu on the required record card and select Edit.
  4. In the Available Attribute window, modify the required fields.
  5. Click Save to save the modified available attributes details.

Edit View

  1. Select the required available attribute record card. The action buttons are displayed in the footer section.
  2. Click Edit to view the Available Attribute window, modify the required fields.
  3. Click Save to save the modified available attributes details.

Details View

 

Swipe Out List

  • Select the required available attribute details. record. Swipe-out menu on the required record card and select Details.
  • In the Available Attribute wizard, you can view the details of the available attribute.

Details View

  • Select the required record card and you can view the action buttons displayed on the footer section.
  • Click Details from the action button to view details of available attribute.

Deleting a Available Attributes

 

The available attribute records can be deleted by following one of the below procedures:

Swipe-out List

  1. Select Menu > Configuration > Common > Available Attributes
  2. Swipe-out menu on the required record card and select Delete.
  3. A confirmation pop-up prompts as 'This action will delete the selected Available Attribute'.
  4. Click Yes to delete the available attribute.

Delete

  1. Select the required record card. The footer section with action buttons is displayed.
  2. Select Delete.
  3. A confirmation pop-up prompts as 'This action will delete the selected Available Attribute'.
  4. Click Yes to delete the available attribute.

 

Field Description

Following are the field descriptions of the attributes available on the screen.

 

Field

 Description
Attribute Id The name of the attribute. e.g., vendor.
Entity ID Source entity to which the attribute ID belongs. e.g item.
Data Type This represents the data type for the attribute.
Attribute Label This represents the text for the attribute. The attribute will appear with this text in the Rule dropdown.
Alternate Name The alternate name of an attribute.
List Data Type The list data type of an attribute.
List Functions The list functions of an attribute.
Source Type The source type of an attribute.
Source URL The source URL of an attribute.
Source Value The source value of an attribute.

 

Action Buttons

Following are the action buttons available on the screen.

 

Select All Rows Selects all the rows of records on the screen.
Export Exports the list of available attributes, and the file will be downloaded onto your system. View Export for more information.
Create Opens the Available Attribute window. 
Deselect Clears the selected records.
Edit Opens the relevant Available Attribute window.
Details Opens the Available Attribute window to provide more details of the selected record.
Delete Deletes the selected record.
